The Science & Story Behind It

The innovation of ‘Nano-Razor’ lies in its maintained burrowing behavior and optimized growth in confined spaces.

  • The rapid burrowing speed and efficiency are preserved through selective breeding for strong foot muscle development and coordinated valve-closing mechanics, essential traits for survival in wild conditions that also benefit harvesting predictability.
  • The dwarf size while maintaining excellent meat-to-shell ratio is achieved by selecting for clams with efficient nutrient partitioning to the edible portions rather than shell elongation.
  • Their synchronized emergence and feeding behavior are enhanced traits that allow for efficient cultivation, as they respond predictably to feeding cycles and water flow patterns in artificial systems.

In short, Dwarf Razor Clam ‘Nano-Razor’ is a texture-unique, rapidly-maturing, and behaviorally-adapted cultivar, bringing the exhilarating hunt and prized crispness of razor clams to controlled urban aquaculture systems.
